ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral otosclerosis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral conductive hearing loss with Carhart notch, absent acoustic reflexes despite normal tympanograms, blue sclera, and positive family history.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech recognition abilities and verify agreement with pure-tone thresholds.
To evaluate middle ear status and tympanic membrane mobility.
To assess the stapedial reflex arc and check for middle ear pathology.
To evaluate neural integrity and differentiate conductive from retrocochlear pathology.
To assess cochlear outer hair cell function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates a bilateral conductive hearing loss with a low-frequency stiffness tilt and a Carhart notch at 2000 Hz. Speech recognition is excellent. Tympanograms are Type A with normal static compliance, yet acoustic reflexes are absent. ABR shows prolonged absolute latencies with normal interpeak latencies, consistent with conductive pathology. TEOAEs are absent. The findings are strongly consistent with otosclerosis.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral conductive hearing loss with low-frequency stiffness tilt and Carhart notch at 2000 Hz. Significant air-bone gaps.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT Right 25 dB HL, Left 35 dB HL; SRS Right 98%, Left 100%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type A tympanograms with normal static compliance (Right 0.7 cc, Left 0.65 cc).

tests.name: ABR
tests.result_summary: All waves prolonged absolute latencies; interpeak latencies normal; latency-intensity function normal.

tests.name: Tone decay test
tests.result_summary: Negative (0 dB decay Right, 5 dB decay Left in 60 seconds).

proposed_items: Referral to otologist for consideration of stapedectomy
Hearing aids (amplification) if surgery is not pursued
counseling_actions: Explain the conductive nature of the hearing loss and the role of middle ear stiffness
Discuss the hereditary nature of otosclerosis and relevance of family history
Discuss the options of surgical intervention versus amplification

escalation.rationale_short: To confirm the diagnosis of otosclerosis and discuss surgical options (stapedectomy).

follow_up_plan.objective: To proceed with surgical intervention or hearing aid fitting based on patient preference and medical advice.
